IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO PROVIDE AFFORDABLE, HIGH QUALITY HEALTHCARE TO ALL.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO PROVIDE AFFORDABLE, HIGH QUALITY HEALTHCARE TO ALL.
IRS990.Desc: COAST COMMUNITY HEALTH CENTER (BCHC) PROVIDES PRIMARY CARE, MENTAL HEALTH, AND WRAP-AROUND SERVICES THAT SUPPORT THE SOCIAL DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH IN THE COMMUNITY. BCHC HAD A TOTAL OF 27,642 ENCOUNTERS AND FILLED 83,930 PERSCRIPTIONS DURING THE YEAR. BCHC PROVIDES CARE TO PERSONS COVERED BY GOVERNMENTAL PROGRAMS, UNINSURED, AND UNDERINSURED. UNREIMBURSED CHARGES FOR SLIDING FEE DISCOUNTS AND CHARITY CARE WAS 499,003 FOR THE YEAR.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION IS ESTABLISHED AS AN OREGON NONPROFIT CHARITABLE CORPORATION, IS EXEMPT FROM STATE AND LOCAL INCOME TAXES, AND HAS BEEN RECOGNIZED BY THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE (IRS) AS EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL INCOME TAXES UNDER INTERNAL REVENUE CODE SECTION 501(C)(3). THE ORGANIZATION IS ANNUALLY REQUIRED TO FILE A RETURN OF ORGANIZATION EXEMPT FROM INCOME TAX (FORM 990) WITH THE IRS. IN ADDITION, THE ORGANIZATION IS SUBJECT TO INCOME TAX ON NET INCOME THAT IS DERIVED FROM BUSINESS ACTIVITIES THAT ARE UNRELATED TO ITS EXEMPT PURPOSE. THE ORGANIZATION HAS DETERMINED IT IS NOT SUBJECT TO UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME TAX AND HAS NOT FILED AN EXEMPT ORGANIZATION BUSINESS INCOME TAX RETURN (FORM 990T) WITH THE IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE D, PAGE 4, PART XI, LINE 2D
SCHEDULE D, PAGE 4, PART XII, LINE 2D
SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ONCE A MEDICAL PROVIDER RECOMMENDS ASSISTANCE FOR AN INDIVIDUAL, THE ORGANIZATION USES A SCREENING AND MANAGEMENT APPROVAL PROCESS. AS OFTEN AS POSSIBLE, PAYMENTS ARE MADE DIRECTLY TO VENDORS/CREDITORS TO ENSURE APPROPRIATE USE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE J, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 1B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL NEW PROFESSIONAL STAFF ARE PROVIDED WITH A HOUSING STIPEND OF 750 PER MONTH FOR THE FIRST THREE MONTHS OF EMPLOYMENT. PAYMENTS ARE MADE DIRECTLY TO THE LANDLORD OR RENTAL COMPANY.

THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS HAS AN EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE CONSISTING OF THE OFFICERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE MAY ACT ON BEHALF OF THE BOARD BETWEEN REGULAR BOARD MEETINGS. ALL ACTIONS TAKEN BY THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE ARE DETERMINED BY A MAJORITY VOTE. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE KEEPS RECORDS OF ITS ACTIVITIES AND PROCEEDINGS AS IT DEEMS APPROPRIATE. ALL ACTIONS BY THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE ARE REPORTED TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AT THE MEETING SUCCEEDING SUCH ACTION AND ARE SUBJECT TO REVISION, ALTERATION AND APPROVAL BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, PROVIDED, HOWEVER, THAT NO RIGHTS OR ACTS OF THIRD PARTIES CAN BE AFFECTED BY SUCH REVISION OR ALTERATION.
DURING THE FISCAL YEAR, THE ORGANIZATION OUTSOURCED ITS CFO POSITION TO COMMUNITY LINK CONSULTING AND BCA, INC.
THE FORM 990 WAS REVIEWED BY THE CFO AND CEO, THEN BY THE FINANCE COMMITTEE PRIOR TO FILING. A FULL COPY WAS PROVIDED TO ALL BOARD MEMBERS BEFORE FILING.

THE ORGANIZATION'S CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY APPLIES TO ALL BOARD MEMBERS, COMMITTEE MEMBERS, OFFICERS, EMPLOYEES, AND VENDORS. WHEN AN ACTUAL, POTENTIAL, OR PERCEIVED CONFLICT OF INTEREST ARISES, THE INDIVIDUAL IS REQUIRED TO NOTIFY THE BOARD OR COMMITTEE. THE INDIVIDUAL MAKES A FULL AND FAIR PRESENTATION OF THE FACTS RELATED TO THE CONFLICT AND ANSWERS QUESTIONS RELATED TO THE MATTER, AFTER WHICH THEY WITHDRAW FROM THE MEETING WHILE THE REMAINING BOARD/COMMITTEE MEMBERS DISCUSS AND VOTE ON THE MATTER. IF IT ISN'T CLEAR WHETHER A CONFLICT OF INTEREST EXISTS, THE INDIVIDUAL WITHDRAWS FROM THE MEETING WHILE THE REMAINING BOARD/COMMITTEE MEMBERS MAKE THE DETERMINATION. IF AN OFFICER OR BOARD MEMBER VIOLATES THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, APPROPRIATE DISCIPLINARY AND CORRECTIVE ACTIONS ARE TAKEN.

THE CEO'S COMPENSATION ANALYSIS IS CONDUCTED BY THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE USING CREDIBLE COMPENSATION SURVEYS FOR FQHC AND NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS. ALL OTHER OFFICERS' COMPENSATION IS REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE CEO USING CREDIBLE COMPENSATION SURVEYS FOR FQHCS AND NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS, SUCH AS OPCA, NWRPCA, AND NACHC.
THE ORGANIZATION'S FORM 990 IS AVAILABLE ON OUR WEBSITE, ON OTHER PUBLIC WEBSITES SUCH AS GUIDESTAR AND PROPUBLICA, AND UPON REQUEST. THE ORGANIZATION'S FORM 1023 IS AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.
THE ORGANIZATION'S CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON WRITTEN REQUEST.
PHARMACY COST OF GOODS SOLD 1,789,881 PHARMACY COST OF GOODS SOLD -1,789,881
